basic.floral_language:
Sedum dasyphyllum 
Floriography: pure, grand, beautiful
Has a beautiful shape with thick fleshy and gray-green to blue-green leaves in an oval shape and arranged in a rosette, leaf surface has thick white powder. In a cool season with adequate light, leaves turn slightly red. Grows slowly, suitable for combinations with other potted succulents.
Likes adequate sunlight, no apparent dormant period. Flowers are purple to red.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, white slightly pink flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, when sunny leaf color turning to pale pink

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, a short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
